item.title: Really? Really. How Our Brains Figure Out What Words Mean Based On How They're Said
item.description: August 24, 2017 - Scientists have identified the brain cells that detect pitch changes in speech, allowing us to understand whether someone is asking a question or making a statement.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 24, 2017 - Scientists have identified the brain cells that detect pitch changes in speech, allowing us to understand whether someone is asking a question or making a statement. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/24/545711940/pitch-neurons

item.title: YouTube Stars Stress Out, Just Like The Rest Of Us
item.description: August 24, 2017 - Young YouTube stars work hard to look authentic and accessible, and they can make millions of dollars doing it. But the pressure to appear perfect while living online can sometimes be too much.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 24, 2017 - Young YouTube stars work hard to look authentic and accessible, and they can make millions of dollars doing it. But the pressure to appear perfect while living online can sometimes be too much. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/24/545552788/youtube-stars-stress-out-just-like-the-rest-of-us

item.title: Abstinence-Only Education Is Ineffective And Unethical, Report Argues
item.description: August 23, 2017 - Researchers say that programs advocating abstinence until marriage fail to get teens to delay sexual activity and also prevent them from getting important information about pregnancy and STDs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - Researchers say that programs advocating abstinence until marriage fail to get teens to delay sexual activity and also prevent them from getting important information about pregnancy and STDs. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/23/545289168/abstinence-education-is-ineffective-and-unethical-report-argues

item.title: Intent On Reversing Its Opioid Epidemic, A State Limits Prescriptions
item.description: August 23, 2017 - Maine is among a handful of states putting limits on the painkiller dose that doctors can prescribe a patient. Some doctors and patients say the law is helping, while others say it goes too far.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - Maine is among a handful of states putting limits on the painkiller dose that doctors can prescribe a patient. Some doctors and patients say the law is helping, while others say it goes too far. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/23/543955887/intent-on-reversing-its-opioid-epidemic-a-state-limits-prescriptions

item.title: Oregon, Texas Lay Down Markers On Abortion Coverage
item.description: August 23, 2017 - Highlighting the country's sharp divide over abortion and mixed reactions to requirements in the Affordable Care Act, Texas restricts insurance coverage while Oregon requires that it be covered.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - Highlighting the country's sharp divide over abortion and mixed reactions to requirements in the Affordable Care Act, Texas restricts insurance coverage while Oregon requires that it be covered. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/23/544543714/oregon-texas-lay-down-markers-on-abortion-coverage

item.title: Does Baby Powder Cause Cancer? A Jury Says Yes. Scientists Aren't So Sure
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Scientists have found an association between talc and ovarian cancer, but they don't agree on exactly what that means.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Scientists have found an association between talc and ovarian cancer, but they don't agree on exactly what that means. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/22/545314093/-417-million-awarded-in-suit-linking-johnson-johnson-baby-powder-to-cancer

item.title: Governors Preparing Bipartisan Health Care Plan For Congress To Consider
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Colorado Democrat John Hickenlooper and Ohio Republican John Kasich are nearing completion on a plan to strengthen the Affordable Care Act exchanges that they will present to the Senate next month.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Colorado Democrat John Hickenlooper and Ohio Republican John Kasich are nearing completion on a plan to strengthen the Affordable Care Act exchanges that they will present to the Senate next month. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/22/545307530/governors-preparing-bipartisan-health-care-plan-for-congress-to-consider

item.title: 'Smart' Pill Bottles Aren't Always Enough To Help The Medicine Go Down
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Lots of people forget to take their medicine on time. Now firms are selling "smart" pill bottles that send patients reminders through the Internet. But maybe the real problem isn't forgetfulness.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Lots of people forget to take their medicine on time. Now firms are selling "smart" pill bottles that send patients reminders through the Internet. But maybe the real problem isn't forgetfulness. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/22/538153337/smart-pill-bottles-arent-enough-to-help-the-medicine-go-down

item.title: Hospitals Could Do More For Survivors Of Opioid Overdoses, Study Suggests
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Researchers say hospitals are missing an opportunity to help people with opioid addiction get into treatment by not doing enough when they show up in emergency rooms after an overdose.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Researchers say hospitals are missing an opportunity to help people with opioid addiction get into treatment by not doing enough when they show up in emergency rooms after an overdose. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/22/545115225/hospitals-could-do-more-for-survivors-of-opioid-overdoses-study-suggests

item.title: The Sugar Story: A Spoonful Of Addiction Makes The Profits Go Up?
item.description:
August 22, 2017 - Americans are facing down a decades-long sugar habit.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-22/the-sugar-story-a-spoonful-of-addiction-makes-the-profits-go-up
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: How To Tell If Watching The Eclipse Damaged Your Eyes
item.description: August 21, 2017 - If you heeded all the warnings, you're likely fine. But spots or blurred vision that shows up 12 hours later or the next day might be a sign that the sun's direct rays permanently hurt the retina.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - If you heeded all the warnings, you're likely fine. But spots or blurred vision that shows up 12 hours later or the next day might be a sign that the sun's direct rays permanently hurt the retina. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/21/545129631/how-to-tell-if-you-ve-damaged-your-eyes-watching-the-eclipse

item.title: With Court's OK, Chile Relaxes One Of The World's Strictest Abortion Bans
item.description: August 21, 2017 - Chilean lawmakers passed a bill earlier this month adding three exceptions to its ban on the procedure. Still, the bill was in limbo — until the Constitutional Court approved it as law Monday.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - Chilean lawmakers passed a bill earlier this month adding three exceptions to its ban on the procedure. Still, the bill was in limbo — until the Constitutional Court approved it as law Monday. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/21/545076995/with-court-s-ok-chile-relaxes-one-of-the-world-s-strictest-abortion-bans

item.title: Global Problems Aid Groups Should Prepare For, If They Want To Survive
item.description: August 21, 2017 - Relief organizations can barely cope with today's famine and refugee crises. Are they ready for the next era of humanitarian emergencies?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - Relief organizations can barely cope with today's famine and refugee crises. Are they ready for the next era of humanitarian emergencies? http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/21/542585015/global-problems-aid-groups-should-prepare-for-if-they-want-to-survive

item.title: Under Trump Rule, Nursing Home Residents May Not Be Able To Sue After Abuse
item.description: August 21, 2017 - The Trump administration is proposing to replace an Obama-era rule that would have made it easier for nursing home residents to sue for negligence or abuse.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - The Trump administration is proposing to replace an Obama-era rule that would have made it easier for nursing home residents to sue for negligence or abuse. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/544973339/trump-rule-could-make-it-harder-for-nursing-home-residents-to-sue-for-abuse

item.title: Home Visits Help Parents Overcome Tough Histories, Raise Healthy Children
item.description: August 21, 2017 - A program that provides $400 million in federal funds for the visits expires next month. Advocates and providers hope it will be reauthorized and even expanded, saying it's money well spent.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - A program that provides $400 million in federal funds for the visits expires next month. Advocates and providers hope it will be reauthorized and even expanded, saying it's money well spent. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/21/544214492/home-visits-help-parents-overcome-tough-histories-raise-healthy-children
